title: Index Pointing at the Viewer
description:
A hand with the index finger pointing straight forward at the person viewing the emoji. Used to represent the word and concept of 'you,' the second-person singular and plural pronoun.

This symbol is seen in art, advertisements, and military recruitment posters as a way to draw the viewer into the image they're looking at.

This hand shape is also used in multiple sign languages from around the world.
apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the index-pointing-at-the-viewer emoji is rendered with a clean, friendly hand shape and a warm, inviting skin tone. The soft, rounded edges and subtle 3D shading give it a gentle yet direct presence, conveying focus and personal engagement. This emoji is perfect for drawing attention to yourself or a specific point in a conversation, making it a direct and assertive way to communicate on Apple devices.
